Uses of Interface
android.text.InputFilter

Packages that use InputFilter
android.text Provides classes used to render or track text and text spans on the screen. 
android.text.method Provides classes that monitor or modify keypad input. 
android.widget The widget package contains (mostly visual) UI elements to use on your Application screen. 
 

Uses of InputFilter in android.text
 

Classes in android.text that implement InputFilter
static class InputFilter.AllCaps
          This filter will capitalize all the lower case letters that are added through edits.
static class InputFilter.LengthFilter
          This filter will constrain edits not to make the length of the text greater than the specified length.
 class LoginFilter
          Abstract class for filtering login-related text (user names and passwords)
static class LoginFilter.PasswordFilterGMail
          This filter is compatible with GMail passwords which restricts characters to the Latin-1 (ISO8859-1) char set.
static class LoginFilter.UsernameFilterGeneric
          This filter rejects characters in the user name that are not compatible with Google login.
static class LoginFilter.UsernameFilterGMail
          This filter rejects characters in the user name that are not compatible with GMail account creation.
 

Methods in android.text that return InputFilter
 InputFilter[] Editable.getFilters()
          Returns the array of input filters that are currently applied to changes to this Editable.
 InputFilter[] SpannableStringBuilder.getFilters()
           
 

Methods in android.text with parameters of type InputFilter
 void Editable.setFilters(InputFilter[] filters)
          Sets the series of filters that will be called in succession whenever the text of this Editable is changed, each of which has the opportunity to limit or transform the text that is being inserted.
 void SpannableStringBuilder.setFilters(InputFilter[] filters)
           
 

Uses of InputFilter in android.text.method
 

Classes in android.text.method that implement InputFilter
 class DateKeyListener
          For entering dates in a text field.
 class DateTimeKeyListener
          For entering dates and times in the same text field.
 class DialerKeyListener
          For dialing-only text entry
 class DigitsKeyListener
          For digits-only text entry
 class NumberKeyListener
          For numeric text entry
 class TimeKeyListener
          For entering times in a text field.
 

Uses of InputFilter in android.widget
 

Fields in android.widget declared as InputFilter
(package private)  InputFilter[] DialerFilter.mInputFilters
           
 

Methods in android.widget that return InputFilter
 InputFilter[] TextView.getFilters()
          Returns the current list of input filters.
 

Methods in android.widget with parameters of type InputFilter
 void TextView.setFilters(InputFilter[] filters)
          Sets the list of input filters that will be used if the buffer is Editable.
